text: Amarna Letter EA4 is a continuation of correspondence between Kadašman-Enlil I and Amenhotep III. The letter is part of a series of correspondences from Babylonia to Egypt, which run from EA2 to EA4 and EA6 to EA14. EA1 and EA5 are from Egypt to Babylonia.W.L.Moran (edited and translated) - The Amarna Letters (p.xvi) published by the Johns Hopkins University Press - Baltimore, London (Brown University) [Retrieved 2015-07-09] In a publication of the Moran translations, the letter is given the title Royal deceit and threats. The letter translated reads: \---- \---- \---- \---- ==See also== *Tammuz (Babylonian calendar) *Ab *Chronology of the ancient Near East *Amarna letters: EA 1, EA 2, EA 3, EA 5, EA 6, EA 7, EA 8, EA 9, EA 10, EA 11 ==References== Category:Amarna greeting letters Category:Amarna letters Category:Babylonian Epigraphs
title: Amarna letter EA 4
